title: 103_hr505
content: The Act titled "Relief for Older Workers Act of 1991" repeals provisions related to deductions on account of work. The "Relief for Older Workers Act of 1991" repeals sections of the Social Security Act related to deductions on account of work. Subsection (b), (c)(1), (d), (f), (h), (j), and (k) of section 203 are repealed, with conforming amendments made to subsection (c) and (e). The "Relief for Older Workers Act of 1991" repeals sections of the Social Security Act related to deductions on account of work. Subsection (e) is redesignated as subsection (c), with amendments made to subsections (g), (i), and (l) as well. Conforming amendments are also made to other provisions. The "Relief for Older Workers Act of 1991" makes amendments to sections of the Social Security Act related to exemptions from reductions based on early retirement and disregard of certain entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments include changes to sections 202(n)(1), 202(q)(5)(B), and 202(q)(7)(A) of the Act. The text discusses amendments to sections of the Social Security Act regarding child's insurance benefits and suspension of aliens' benefits. Amendments include changes to sections 202(s)(1), 202(s)(3), and 202(t)(7) of the Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions related to benefits increased on account of delayed retirement, reductions in benefits based on maximum benefits, and penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings for periods subject to deductions on account of work. Amendments to the Social Security Act include provisions on determining benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and substantial gainful activity for blind individuals. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to the exempt amount for certain individuals and the definition of income for SSI purposes. For paragraph (1)(A), 'wages' means wages defined in section 209, excluding specified remuneration limitations. Services not considered employment under section 210 are deemed employment if remuneration is not included in net earnings. 'Wages' excludes certain employee payments. The curr_chunk discusses payments made to employees or their dependents on account of retirement or termination of employment. It also mentions the repeal of deductions under the railroad retirement program. The amendments and repeals made by this Act will be effective for taxable years ending on or after the enactment date of this Act.
